page.title: 01LOCAL HISTORY
page.content:
{THE ORIGIN OF COTSWOLD?} THE NAME OF COATES OR 'DE COTES' FIRST APPEARED IN THE RECORDS OF 1201. THE MANORS OF ACHELIE, LISTED IN THE DOMESDAY SURVEY 0F 1086, WERE KNOWN AS THE COTES MANORS AND WERE SHEEP FARMS OR CLEARINGS.IN THE 15TH CENTURY 'COTTESWOLDE'IS FOUND IN THE RECORDS AND IT IS THOUGHT THAT THIS MIGHT BE THE DERIVATION OF THE MODERN COTSWOLD. SHEEP STILL GRAZE IN THE FIELDS.
{THE DESERTED VILLAGE.} HULLASEY, ALSO MENTIONED IN THE DOMESDAY SURVEY, WAS DESERTED. AN EXCAVATION OF THE SITE WAS MADE IN 1907 AND A FURTHER SURVEY IN 1982. IT IS THOUGHT TO HAVE BEEN DESERTED IN THE 15TH CENTURY DUE TO AN EPIDEMIC. YOUNG TREES HAVE NOW BEEN PLANTED THERE.
